snippet: A ruling on the N.F.L.’s contention that the concussion-related lawsuits of more than 4,000 former players should not be heard in court is expected by this summer.
abstract: United States District Court Judge Anita B Brody hears arguments by lawyers representing 4,000 former players and their wives who claim NFL knew about and hid long-term dangers of head trauma; lawyers representing NFL argue that case should be dismissed because players signed collective bargaining agreement.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and JON HURDLE

lead_paragraph: A ruling on the N.F.L.’s contention that the concussion-related lawsuits of more than 4,000 former players should not be heard in court is expected by this summer.

headline.seo: Judge Hears N.F.L. Arguments to Dismiss Head Trauma Cases
headline.print_headline: Arguments Are Heard in N.F.L. Head Trauma Case
